result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fong Cha

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Defendant Fong Cha in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Fong Cha.  Attorney Lucas D Arras in court for State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF371, 22TR8529, 20CM219, 20CF479, 19TR7868

Interpreter Snowdon Herr appears by Zoom, is sworn in and interprets

State - asks Court to take judicial notice of the bond in Dunn County case 20CF479
Atty Erdman - no objection
Court - makes statement re: case numbering history, takes judicial notice of the bond in Dunn County case 20CF479
State - calls Deputy Greg Moen who is sworn in and testifies
Deputy Greg Moen identifies deft
Atty Erdman - no questions for this witness
Deputy Greg Moen is excused as witness
Neither party has any further witnesses for today
State - moves for bind over
Atty Erdman - no argument for today
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial, schedules ARGN

Atty Erdman - asks to be heard on bond, notes no motion was filed, makes argument for bond modification
State - makes argument, objects to any modification of bond
Court - will not modify bonds today
** Clerk to schedule all cases for 1/12 at 1:30 **
Arraignment scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

1:18 PM Defendant Fong Cha appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Fong Cha.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Interpreter Snowdon Herr appears by zoom, is sworn in and interprets

20CF479, 22CF371, 22TR5829, 20CM219

20CF470 - Bond Mod Hearing
State - asks to amend from $1100 sign bond to $3000 cash bond - asks for bond to be concurrent with 22CF371
Atty Lundeen - makes argument for lower cash bond of $100 to be concurrent with 22CF371
Court - orders $1100 sign bond in 20CF479 be converted to $1100 cash bond - absolute sobriety (No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.)  orders $1500 cash bond in 22CF371 -  absolute sobriety (No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.)

INIT for 22CF371
Atty Lundeen - waives reading and requests speedy prelim
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
